New Records: The New York Mets are the first team in MLB history to clinch a postseason spot in a win and win a playoff series BOTH via games in which they faced a deficit in the 9th inning or later
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead three-run homer
Starling Marte added a single to make it 4-2
Francisco Lindor hit a two-run home run to give them the win in that one
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets were 24-35 at one point this season but put together a fantastic final 90 games or so in order to make the postseason
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets will play the division-rival Philadelphia Phillies, who they saw 13 teams during the regular season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets needed to win a game in Atlanta just to get into the playoffs
The Mets haven't made the World Series since 2015
Others: The game was played at American Family Field in Milwaukee, Wis.
